description: A fruit that is red or green.
A fruit that is yellow.
A vegetable that is orange.
A common pet.
Another common pet.
A pet that swims.
An electronic device.
A smaller electronic device.
An even smaller electronic device.
Something you sit on.
Something you read.
A clear liquid you drink.
The star at the center of our solar system.
Earth's natural satellite.
A tall plant with a trunk and branches.
A building where people live.
A vehicle with four wheels.
A round object used in games.
Something you wear on your foot.
A musical instrument with strings.
A large musical instrument with keys.
An instrument for viewing distant objects.
An instrument for viewing very small objects.
An instrument for finding direction.
A representation of an area of land or sea.
An instrument for measuring time.
A device for taking photographs.
A vehicle with two wheels.
A flying vehicle.
The process by which plants make their own food.
The force that attracts a body towards the center of the earth.
The process by which different kinds of living organisms are thought to have developed.
A system of government by the whole population.
The study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.
The scientific study of the human mind and its functions.
The study of the development, structure, and functioning of human society.
The study of human societies and cultures and their development.
The study of human history and prehistory through the excavation of sites.
The scientific study of language and its structure.
A food made of flour, water, and yeast mixed together and baked.
A food made from the pressed curds of milk.
A white liquid produced by mammals.
An oval or round object laid by female birds.
A swamp grass which is widely cultivated as a source of food.
A dish originally from Italy consisting of dough made from durum wheat and water.
A dish of Italian origin consisting of a usually round, flat base of leavened wheat-based dough.
A cold dish of various mixtures of raw or cooked vegetables.
A liquid dish, typically made by boiling ingredients in stock or water.
An item of food consisting of two pieces of bread with meat, cheese, or other filling between them.
A Japanese dish of prepared vinegared rice.
A Mexican dish consisting of a fried tortilla.
A Mexican dish consisting of a tortilla rolled around a filling.
A round patty of ground beef, fried or grilled and typically served in a split bun.
A cooked sausage served in a long, soft roll.
Batons of deep-fried potato.
A soft, sweet frozen food made with milk and cream.
A food preparation in the form of a paste or solid block made from roasted and ground cacao seeds.
A hot drink made from the roasted and ground seeds of a tropical shrub.
A hot drink made by infusing the dried, crushed leaves of a plant in boiling water.
A crystalline compound that is found especially in tea and coffee plants.
A colorless volatile flammable liquid that is the intoxicating constituent of wine, beer, spirits, and other drinks.
A toxic colorless or yellowish oily liquid that is the chief active constituent of tobacco.
A compound present in the body as a neurotransmitter and a precursor of other substances including epinephrine.
A compound present in blood platelets and serum that constricts the blood vessels and acts as a neurotransmitter.
A hormone secreted by the adrenal glands, especially in conditions of stress.
Any of a group of hormones secreted within the brain and nervous system and having a number of physiological functions.
A hormone released by the pituitary gland that causes increased contraction of the uterus during labor and stimulates the ejection of milk into the ducts of the breasts.
A steroid hormone produced by the adrenal cortex and used medicinally to treat inflammation resulting from eczema and rheumatism.
A hormone secreted by the pineal gland that inhibits melanin formation and is thought to be concerned with regulating the reproductive cycle.
Move at a speed faster than a walk.
Move at a regular and fairly slow pace.
Push oneself off a surface and into the air.
Propel the body through water by using the limbs.
Move through the air using wings.
Make musical sounds with the voice.
Move rhythmically to music.
Look at and comprehend the meaning of written or printed matter.
Mark letters, words, or other symbols on a surface.
Produce a picture or diagram by making lines and marks on paper.
Apply paint to a surface.
Create or represent something by carving, casting, or other shaping techniques.
Take action; do something.
Control the operations of; manage or govern.
Make or manufacture from components or raw materials.
Write or create a work of art, especially music or poetry.
Compose the sequence of steps and moves for a performance of dance.
Prepare written, photographic, or recorded material for publication by correcting, condensing, or otherwise modifying it.
Bring to life.
Provide a computer or other machine with coded instructions for the automatic performance of a particular task.
Make something by synthesis, especially chemically.
Examine methodically and in detail the constitution of something.
Evaluate a theory or practice in a detailed and analytical way.
Advance a hypothesis.
Form a theory or set of theories about something.
Form a concept or idea of something.
Form an idea of; imagine or conceive.
Perform or utter repeatedly.
Make changes in something established, especially by introducing new methods, ideas, or products.
Interrupt an event, activity, or process by causing a disturbance or problem.
